body: @SudharmaJain can you comment on @pedro-martins 's comment?
LGTM, if we don't have any outstanding objections -- let's merge this?
@dmytro-shevchenko can you rebase against latest master (with 4.9xx as the version) etc.
@kishankavala please rebase against latest master and move the sqls to the recent sql paths

LGTM, dead code remove nice :)
Merging based on 2+LGTMs
LGTM, merging based on comments
LGTM, merging based on comments and tests
Ping?
LGTM, can we have regression test results against VMware then we would be able to merge this.
@sanju1010 please squash changes in to a single commit and comment if all outstanding issues are resolved now?
LGTM, should we merge this?
LGTM, let's merge after some tests
LGTM, has anyone tested this other than the author?
LGTM
@ustcweizhou please add the "GB" label after the string, then we can merge this. Thanks.
@ProjectMoon yes please squash them and maybe open a new PR against 4.7 (or 4.6) closing this one as github won't allow you to edit/change the source/dest branches.

@rafaelweingartner fair points, but it would make sense if you can comment on the diff in the context of the change.

Specific to the PR I see several testXXXLockableAccount which tries to test account types separately. Are you suggesting to get them all refactored, say put in a single testLockableAccount() and use a single Account/User object to test the lockability instead of explicitly separate test methods?
New request is located at https://github.com/apache/cloudstack/pull/1372.
I don't have the close button, so this one needs to be closed again.
Which file is missing the license? Still don't see that in the Jenkins build.
@agneya2001 how about you have a look at the test tomorrow and see if you can incorporate some of the suggestions like pull out the account from the method as a class variable?
@nnesic since you're the author you can close this PR  @ProjectMoon thanks for the new PR
@ProjectMoon do you want to merge this only on master or since 4.6/4.7? Check the target branch of the PR.
@rafaelweingartner @bhaisaab I have taken out the duplicate account initialisation.
Yes.. wrong branch again. GitHub's cross-fork interface tends to be a bit confusing for me due to how it loads when you change repos. Attempt #3 coming up.
@cristofolini your changes are incorporated can you review these.
@ProjectMoon :) Github need to fix this, really annoying
License has been added.
@bhaisaab see PR #1374 #1375 and #1376
Thanks @milamberspace

@ProjectMoon The code is better now, well documented and with tests.
LGTM.
@bhaisaab Why merge without running integration tests? How do we know this doesn't break anything else?
Looks good at first, but I would like to see some UnitTests around methods. I'll comment on those inline.
@DaanHoogland Have you been able to fix this? Code-wise it still seems good.
Code looks good, but I have no way of testing this since I don't have Swift...
Can we rebase against master (4.9)? Seems that this one is ready to merge

Folks, I did not have time to fully test the new merging process from @DaanHoogland and @remibergsma but let's assume this is good to merge should this really be merged in master first. What about the other release branches @bhaisaab ?
@bhaisaab @pdube @DaanHoogland @koushik-das lots of LGTM here , so great. but we don't know why you LGTM'd and as far as I know no tests were run...
Thanks for the reminder Rohit. I will update this PR accordingly.
@bhaisaab rebased
add (GB) to the label. Please test it.

@bhaisaab I am still not very confident if we can remove sending stop command to when VM is in the the poweroff state (on host) and stopped state (in DB). But as @DaanHoogland  mentioned one scenario I think we can not remove it. 

We can go ahead with the current fix in the PR, but please check that it doesn't break anything that I am not aware or have missed?

@wido yes it was fixed. The problem was the newlines in the pattern to search for. I had not taken that in account for in the unit test. We are about to put this in production but first I have to check how the status of the tests are.
@jayapalu The test may pass, but my manual (scripted cloudmonkey) test doesn't so we need to figure out what goes wrong. See my comments above.
@remibergsma build/smoke tests passed, constructor definition was changed with unused variables removed
@runseb this was sent for master as the author intended, non-issue actually but would satisfy SonarQube from showing up redflags
@rafaelweingartner thanks; @remibergsma should we let this be merged considering your integration test result, or you want to re-run them?
cc @remibergsma requires merging on 4.6 and consequent fwd merges
@agneya2001 Sounds like you want to set the style guide. you and @rafaelweingartner should take this discussion to a higher level and take it to a discuss thread.

@DaanHoogland I agree there should be some guideline on code style. If these are there I think most of us will be willing to follow these. I guess it will not be difficult to adapt something that is already out there.

TEST RESULT :  
@summary: Test  if SS creation is successful in the first ... === TestName: test_05_check_vm_snapshot_creation_after_Instance_creation | Status : SUCCESS ===
ok

---

Ran 1 test in 305.719s

OK
@sarathkouk please remove the internal bug reference and replace it by an apache equivalent.

Hi @bhaisaab I am genuinely asking because of the new release principles:
https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/CLOUDSTACK/Release+principles+for+Apache+CloudStack+4.6+and+up

where we agreed to apply to release branches and merge forward.

Now this is not a bug per se, so could go directly to master, but I think it could be applied as a "fix" and merged forward

@bhaisaab actually I am not even seeing the travis runs here anymore.

Reason I am asking is genuine (again), because in the last few months Travis has shown to be flaky and was Green when actually tests did not run ...
@runseb We could see it as a bug, but I agree with @bhaisaab that it is a non-issue that was "fixed" to make SonarQube happy. Fine to do that straight on master IMHO.

@runseb @bhaisaab I think this is worth a small but intensive discussion, preferably over a beer. What we are talking about is neither a bug nor a feature. We never mentioned this kind of improvement in are procedures. My instict goes with the way @bhaisaab handled this but that is worth less then €0,02.
@bhaisaab @remibergsma @DaanHoogland ok then, just checking.
Says a license is missing, but this only touches one existing file.
Yes, nothing to do with your code but it is genuine. You can add the license to ActionEventUtilsTest to make the build pass. The license is there in higher branches.
looks good but needs testing, right? might be a runtime issue.

I added the license header.

Out of curiosity, I ran the `org.apache.rat:apache-rat-plugin:0.10:check` locally on my PR branch and it reported 59 failures rather than the 1 failure here. Any ideas?

@DaanHoogland sure. There are no imports (git grep org.springframework.security to check) from any part of the codebase and since I had put it in I know for sure it's not at least used by the SAML plugin (which only uses OpenSAML lib). I can help run manual runtime tests since that requires a IdP server next week or later.
have a look in target/rat.txt and see what those are. maybe some remanence of your prior work.
Seems good to me looking at it. Don't know how to test it properly, but code-wise the changes look sane to me.
I added the license check to ActionEventUtilsTest and of course now the checks pass. But may it is a better idea to put the license in as a separate PR? Not exactly related to this commit.
LGTM, did not test it.

It looks like it was some old Debian package build causing a bunch of extraneous files to be placed into the rat report. Cleaned up those and the report is now much more in line with what the Jenkins job is reporting.
Added the license header to the MockUsageEventDao class to fix rat report error.
After some discussion on IRC, going to remove the addition of the license header here and fix it in a separate PR.

Hi @ProjectMoon ,
Out of curiosity, why did you create the "server/test/com/cloud/user/MockUsageEventDao.java" class?
My god I swear GitHub's PR interface can die in a fire. Wrong base branch again.

I'm not the original author of this work, but I think it was just because a class for testing was needed. Looking at it now I'm not really sure why it can't just be the regular `UsageEventDao` with `@Mock`. I will try to find out the intention behind it, and then remove the class if it's not needed.

Edit: reason I got back is that she was following the pattern of other tests (AccountManager tests specifically).
@rafaelweingartner I have removed the MockUsageEventDao and replaced it with a normal Mockito mock of the UsageEventDao interface.
Added unit tests

LGTM based on the code.

Hi @bhaisaab , Which test files would you like me to run? Is this ok with this command on each file? nosetests --with-marvin --marvin-config=setup/dev/advanced.cfg test/integration/...file.py Or is it a command to run multiple files? Thanks

@bhaisaab Could you please do the following changes?

At **VirtualMachineVolumeChainInfo** class:
**1 -** create Javadoc blocks (would be nice to document all the class, but I think that at least the class and the "getControllerFromDeviceBusName" method deserves a documentation);
**2 -** simplify the **if** conditional at line **43**. Test with "( (StringUtils.isEmpty) || (!this.diskDeviceBusName.contains(":")) )" condition. The StringUtils.isEmpty method already checks if the String is empty("") or null (https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-lang/apidocs/org/apache/commons/lang3/StringUtils.html).
**3 -** create test for the getControllerFromDeviceBusName method.

At **UserVmManagerImpl** class:
**1 -** document the "persistDeviceBusInfo(UserVmVO vm, String rootDiskController)" method (lines **5458-5466**).
**2 -** use the "StringUtils.isEmpty()" with the condition at line **5460**, instead of "(existingVmRootDiskController==null) || (existingVmRootDiskController.isEmpty())".
**3 -** create test for "persistDeviceBusInfo(UserVmVO vm, String rootDiskController)" method.

**VolumeApiServiceImpl**:
**1 -** Remove “**_**” from variables names (lines **200**, **252**, **267**): private variables with “**_**” at the beginning is common in C++ but not in Java.

Thanks.
With the tests this looks good to me. I have no way of verifying the Swift working itself, but based on the code and tests: LGTM

Should the three commits be squashed? Or left in three? I suggest perhaps splitting the unit test commit into two, and putting each unit test with its corresponding refactor commit, so the end result is two commits, each refactoring one part of system VM network selection and providing an associated unit test.

Congratulations, the code is much better now.
I can give LGTM now without doubt

The checks failed on unit tests which exist only on pull request #1360. Which is ... interesting. Will try to retrigger build.
